stance_1: I am concerned about animal welfare
stance_2: Eating animals makes me feel sick inside
justification: The interviewee explicitly links animal welfare concerns to their emotional discomfort when eating animals.

stance_1: I am concerned about animal welfare
stance_2: I wish to give up meat
justification: The desire to give up meat is explicitly motivated by animal welfare concerns.

stance_1: Eating animals makes me feel sick inside
stance_2: I wish to give up meat
justification: Feeling sick about eating animals supports the wish to give up meat.

stance_1: I crave the taste of meat
stance_2: I wish to give up meat
justification: The craving for meat taste directly conflicts with the wish to give up meat.

stance_1: I crave the taste of meat
stance_2: I want to remove meat from my menu
justification: The craving for meat taste conflicts with the desire to remove meat from the menu.

stance_1: I crave the taste of meat
stance_2: I feel addicted to the taste of meat
justification: Feeling addicted to the taste of meat is explicitly described as craving for it.

stance_1: I eat meat about three days a week
stance_2: I prefer to avoid meat four days a week
justification: Eating meat three days and avoiding it four days are opposing behaviors as part of a self-imposed balance.

stance_1: I eat meat about three days a week
stance_2: I wish to give up meat
justification: Wishing to give up meat conflicts with the actual behavior of eating it three days a week.

stance_1: I feel addicted to the taste of meat
stance_2: I wish to give up meat
justification: Feeling addicted to the taste of meat makes it harder to give up meat.

stance_1: I feel addicted to the taste of meat
stance_2: I want to remove meat from my menu
justification: Feeling addicted to the taste of meat conflicts with the desire to remove meat from the menu.

stance_1: I like the flavoring of meat
stance_2: I want to remove meat from my menu
justification: Liking meat flavoring conflicts with the desire to remove meat unless a suitable alternative is found.

stance_1: I wish to give up meat
stance_2: I want to remove meat from my menu
justification: The desire to give up meat and to remove meat from the menu are directly aligned.

stance_1: My family is moving toward humanely raised meat
stance_2: My family is skeptical about organic meat
justification: Skepticism about organic meat is in tension with the movement toward humanely raised meat, though the shift is happening despite skepticism.
